result.execSummary:
The defendant Dean B Bellefeuille was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate "B" Permit/License Closing Hours, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 125.32(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dean B Bellefeuille

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dean B Bellefeuille in court.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM13 and 15CM32 called.  State recites agreement.  Court questions Defendant regarding right to attorney.  The Court finds waiver of attorney is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given.  Court questions Defendant regarding plea.

15CM13 - Guilty plea

15CM32 - Dismiss and Read in

The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  State relates.  Court relates and orders:

15CM13
$1,000.00 fine plus costs - 60 DTP

Defendant Dean B Bellefeuille in court.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
COVERS 15CM13 AND 15CM32.
Reset.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.
Defendant must comply with WI closing hours.
Defendant to be fingerprinted.

Defendant Dean B Bellefeuille in court.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives right to attorney. Defendant pleads NG.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
